Isotretinoin embryopathy, bilateral anotia, and Taussig-Bing malformation are all diseases or conditions mentioned in the paragraph. Isotretinoin embryopathy is a condition caused by the use of isotretinoin during pregnancy, resulting in birth defects. Bilateral anotia refers to the absence of both ears, and Taussig-Bing malformation is a congenital heart defect characterized by subaortic stenosis and patent ductus arteriosus.
